channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: AeroGarden, a Pandemic-Era Phenomenon, Is No More. What Happens Next?
item.description: The hydroponic plant-growing company is shutting down. Here’s what to expect growing forward if you own any AeroGarden devices.

item.title: The US Has a Cloned Sheep Contraband Problem
item.description: After a Montana man illegally cloned and bred an endangered giant sheep species, government agencies must now contend with the illicit offspring.

item.title: Swiggy’s public debut will test India’s appetite for $1B+ IPOs
item.description: Swiggy’s upcoming IPO on Wednesday will finally give many analysts a public comparable for what has been long considered to be the Indian internet sto...

item.title: Gift Guide 2024: The best gadgets for new home owners
item.description: In August, I did something I never imagined myself doing: I bought a house. After spending most of my adult life in New York City, I moved a couple of...

item.title: From self-driving cars to AI that writes enterprise software: Cogna founder raises $15M
item.description: A founder who was an early mover in the race to build autonomous vehicles has raised $15 million for his next act: a startup that claims its AI can wr...

item.title: Hisense PX3-Pro Review: A Giant TV Alternative
item.description: This Dolby Vision–enabled laser projector is a cinematic solution for stylish living rooms.

item.title: Meta taps US, UK universities to test VR in education, creates digital twin ‘metaversities’ in Europe
item.description: As part of an ongoing effort to embed virtual reality (VR) in education, Meta has launched a new partnership with a slew of universities in the U.S. a...

item.title: Intuitive Machines CEO: ‘We now have the platform for a lunar economy’
item.description: Steve Altemus is optimistic. And as CEO of Intuitive Machines, which made history with the first ever successful moon landing performed by a private c...

item.title: 7 Best Cheap Smartphones (2024): iPhone, Android, 5G
item.description: There’s little reason to pay top dollar for a smartphone. These iPhones and Android devices—ranging from $150 to $500—stood up to WIRED’s testing.

item.title: Big Sneaker Brands Promised a 3D-Printed Revolution. These Are the Disrupters Making It Happen
item.description: 3D printing is injecting much-needed innovation into sneaker design, but it’s small brands that are leading where big names are struggling—or hesitant...
